findings.title: Balance invariant can't be assured
findings.description: It is possible to forcibly send ether to a contract without triggering the execution of any code, causing the check require (this.balance == 0) to fail and stop the contract from executing any atomic match operation.

findings.title: Protocol Fee can be avoided
findings.description: If a transaction is being made using the protocol fee method, both parties can set all their order fee to zeros and still succeed.

findings.title: Beware of malicious token implementations
findings.description: Accepting any ERC20 token opens the protocol and its users to attacks from malicious tokens, which can disguise themselves as honest ones and avoid protocol fees.
